founder.name: Dr. Effiong Udo Umoren
founder.title: Founder and Father of Homeopathy in Nigeria

earlyLife.birthPlace: Ikot Akpan, Ikot-Eyo in Ubium clan, Nsit Ubium Local Government Area of Akwa Ibom State
earlyLife.father: Effiong Udo Umoren - popular and renowned herbalist, traditional medicine healer and farmer
earlyLife.mother: Mrs. Edemekong Udo Umoren from Obio Akpa Idu in Ubium clan

education.primary: Native authority school at Ikot Okwot (completed standard three)
education.secondary: Presbyterian Primary School at Itu (finished standard six)
certifications: General Certificate of Education, Junior Cambridge (1920)

internationalEducation.institution: International Free Protestant Episcopal University, London
degrees: Doctor of Philosophy in Homeopathic Medicine (PhD) - St. Andrew's intercollegiate foundation, London
Degree in Psychology - University of the Science of man in Great Britain (1971)
Doctor of Botanic medicine - Brandridge forest school-London (1972)
fellowships: Fellow of Indian Academy of Science

practice.specialization: Pioneer practitioner in Homoeopathy and natural therapeutics

achievements: First practitioner of homeopathic system of medicine in Nigeria
Founder of first Association of Nigerian Homeopathic and natural therapeutics in 1965 (Registration No. 130384)
First president and Founding father of Nigerian Homeopathic Association
Well known columnist in the monitor Newspaper
Elder statesman in the vanguard for the struggle of emancipation from colonial masters
Effective representative of Ubium county council for about twelve years
Appointment to local school Board, Etinan L.G.A. (1971-1974)
character: Reserved in early life, loved quiet life
Researchful and fond of asking questions
Great dreamer of dreams and a doer of deeds
Dedicated to noble ideals, entirely selfless
Truthful in speech, fearless in action
Meek as a lamb, but a lion in spirit

religiousLife.ministry: Started ministry at age 12, claimed divine call
religiousLife.contribution: Leased property to Qua Iboe church, Ikot Eyo for worship centre
religiousLife.generosity: Sent money, church Hymnaries and bibles every year

politicalLife.service: Representative of Ubium county council (12 years)

foundation.originalName: Cottage Homoeopathic Medical College and Hospital
foundation.state: Cross River State (now Akwa Ibom State)
foundation.purpose: Teaching of classical and modern Homoeopathy as well as other alternative medicine

currentLocation.address: No.1 Uwa Street, Uyo opposite ministry of Education (Examinations and Certification Division)
currentLocation.city: Uyo Capital City of Akwa Ibom State

contact.visitPolicy: Previous appointment essential, minimum 48hrs notice required

timeline.event: College founded by Dr. E. U. Umoren
timeline.name: Cottage Homoeopathic Medical College and Hospital

timeline.event: Dr. E. U. Umoren passed away peacefully
timeline.description: End of year party with students, took bible to bedroom, peaceful transition next morning

timeline.event: 10 man committee set up to edit, review and rewrite college curriculum
timeline.description: More comprehensive, authentic, accurate and elucidated compilation

approvedBy: FOUNDATION FOR HOMOEOPATHIC EDUCATION AND RESEARCH
curriculumApproval.description: Invaluable book of reference for lecturers and students

faculties.name: Alternative/Complementary Medicine
faculties.description: Various departments offering degrees, post graduate diploma, advanced diploma, diploma and certificate programs

objectives: To produce homoeopathic and other alternative medical doctors with technical, analytical, diagnostic, scientific, medical and pharmaceutical knowledge
To produce pharmaceutical scientists, chemists, and druggists in alternative medicine
To award certificate, diploma and degree to highly competent, ethically and professionally sound persons
To assist in the scientific evaluation of medical claims by practitioners of traditional medicine
To produce properly trained alternative medical practitioners at both sub-professional and professional levels
To make students aware that higher education carries obligation to contribute to betterment of man and society
To encourage students to develop system of values against which to judge use of knowledge and skills

facilities.equipment: Modern charts and specimens demonstrated to students by respective lecturers

researchCenter.requirement: Application in writing stating credentials or curriculum vitae

fellowshipPrivileges: Certificate of fellowship, signed personally by the patron of the college
Title fellow of the modern college of Homoeopathy/Alternative medicine and use of the letters (FMOCHAM)
Eligibility for Associate membership of the All Nigerian Homeopathic medical association
Preferential rates and reservation at all College seminars worldwide
Receipt of all college international Newsletters free for three years

medicalPhilosophy.philosophy: Alternative medicine embodies scientific methods and art of healing

recognition.who: World Health Organization recognizing that no system of medicine is a panacea
recognition.treatmentApproach: Rational treatment consists not so much on curing or removing diseases, but on restoring maximum function and supporting patient in making necessary lifestyle changes
recognition.role: Practitioner fulfils essential educative and preventive role
recognition.internationalSupport: Many civilized countries taking steps to strengthen alternative legal position, some giving federal and state support

legacy.graduates: Produced eminent Homeopathic medical Doctors and nurses in almost all states in Nigeria and other countries like Cameroun, Ghana etc.
legacy.reputation: Dr. E. U. Umoren's name enshrined in legends, deeds sung by village ministrels throughout Nigeria
legacy.impact: Became the king of a small principality, but yet reigns supreme in the heart of millions of countrymen
legacy.historicalSignificance: Passed into history and has become a name
